StartButtonSelected.Description: first frame where the start button is selected

MazeStart.Description: First frame where the maze start tile is selected

MazeFinish.Description: First frame where the final tile of the maze path is selected

RuleBreakingError.Description: First frame where touch target is on a tile that does not follow the rules

RuleAbidingError.Description: First frame where touch target is on a tile that does follow the rules; but is not on the hidden path

PerseverativeError.Description: First frame where the touch target is on a tile following an error; but the tile is not the last correct touch

CorrectResponse.Description: Selected the correct tile within the scene

LastCorrectSelection.Description: Reselected the tile that represents their current location in the maze

TouchErrorImageOn.Description: Vertical lines shown for not sufficiently maintaining selection

TouchErrorImageOff.Description: Vertical lines on screen from touch duration error are removed

FlashingTileFbOn.Description: Last correct tile flashes green due to perseverative error

FlashingTileFbOff.Description: Last correct tile stops flashing green

NoChoice.Description: Trial aborted due to object selection period timing out

MazeOn.Description: Maze is made visible on the screen

MazeOff.Description: Maze is removed from the screen

TileFbOn.Description: Tile feedback made visible on the screen

TileFbOff.Description: Tile feedback made not visible on the screen

Fluid1Onset.Description: Command sent to initiate fluid reward

ContextCode.Description: 100-999 indicates the current context code (must be defined by the experimenter)

StimCode.Description: 1000-1999 indicates the current stimulus code (must be defined by the experimenter in stimDef)

TrialIndex.Description: 2000-3999 indicates TrialIndex, which iterates every trial, regardless of aborted status. Most data files have new file saved every TrialIndex.

TrialNumber.Description: 4000-5999 indicates TrialNumber, which only iterates if trial is not aborted. Most interesting data only occurs when this iterates.

TileCode.Description: 7000 8999 indicates the current tile code (must be defined by the experimenter in the Maze folder)
